noun.description: Atypical myotonia; specifically (more fully "congenital paramyotonia", "paramyotonia congenita") a familial (autosomal dominant) disorder characterized by attacks of myotonia typically triggered by exposure to cold, with intermittent flaccid muscle weakness, caused by mutations of the skeletal muscle sodium channel.

origin: Late 19th century; earliest use found in William Richard Gowers (1845–1915), physician. From para- + myo- + -tonia, after German Paramyotonie.
